text: Jack Boris Brown (born 1922), was a male rower who competed for England. ==Fencing career== He represented England and won a bronze medal in the double sculls with Ken Tinegate at the 1950 British Empire Games in Auckland, New Zealand. ==Personal life== During the Games in 1950 he lived at Hume House, Sparrow Hill, Loughborough and was a company director and was a member of the Loughborough Boat Club. ==References== Category:English male rowers Category:Rowers at the 1950 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in rowing Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for England Category:Possibly living people Category:1922 births
title: Jack Brown (rower)
